Comments_List: I gained a considerable amount of fluency in French grammar.
Basic French conversation and grammar. How to express my own thoughts in French.

This course uses books that state that the student should be able ti use them in a year to be able to understand them. But the whole course meant for a year is compressed into one semester, making it extremely fast-paced and difficult to keep up. But overall it is worth it if you can keep up. Given the time available, it's the best method of learning french.
Sometimes I felt things were going to fast, but it was not humanly impossible to catch up with it. But I wish there would have been more support for the students to move from FREN 110 towards 120.
Absolutely. This course uses the capretz method which according to me is a very effective approach at gaining fluency in French.

Yes, French is a hard language to master. One should memorise each conjugation, pronunciation, complicated grammar, and vocabulary (especially idiomatic expressions that do not have English counterparts). But, this course lets you improve your French skills through diverse ways of training, like presentations, conversations, grammar explanations, and well-organised exams.
